page.title: 08INDUSTRY
page.content: The largest employer in the area is {ICI}at Winnington which employs close to a thousand people. A second factory at Wallerscote closed in 1984. Winnington ICI was started by John Brunner and a German chemist, Ludwig Mond. There is still a Brunner Library in Northwich. The major product of Winnington is soda ash. Raw materials are brought in by river, road and via the large railway sidings. When Wallerscote was working, a single track railway, which still exists, connected the factory with Weaverham, and from there to the main line. The most important use of soda ash is in the manufacture of glass. The replacement of glass by plastics was one reason for the rundown of Wallerscote works.
